author: Joshua Fluke
description:
“Career minimalism” is the newest corporate buzzword — and somehow it’s already being framed as a problem.

Apparently, if you don’t want to climb an infinite corporate ladder, take on extra work for free, or accept a “promotion” without more pay… congrats. You’ve been labeled a career minimalist.

In this video, I break down:
What “career minimalism” actually means (and why it’s not laziness)
Why Gen Z is rejecting unpaid responsibility and fake promotions
How companies moved the goalposts on “career progression”
Why management titles without pay are a downgrade, not a win
The rise of side hustles as a survival strategy — not a passion project
How remote work exposed how much of corporate life is unnecessary
Why older generations tied identity to work — and why that’s changing

It’s about doing exactly what you’re paid for — and no more.
Companies optimize for profits. Workers are finally optimizing for themselves.

🔥 Need a resume/cover letter? Check out my templates!  
https://www.
title: THE CORPORATE LADDER WAS ALWAYS A LIE - CAREER MINIMALISM
